name: Niger
introduction: Niger became independent from France in 1960 and experienced single-party and military rule until 1991 when Gen. Ali SAIBOU was forced by public pressure to allow multiparty elections which resulted in a democratic government in 1993. Political infighting brought the government to a standstill and in 1996 led to a coup by Col. Ibrahim BARE. In 1999 BARE was killed in a counter coup by military officers who restored democratic rule and held elections that brought Mamadou TANDJA to power in December of that year. TANDJA was reelected in 2004 and in 2009 spearheaded a constitutional amendment allowing him to extend his term as president. In February 2010 military officers led a coup that deposed TANDJA and suspended the constitution. ISSOUFOU Mahamadou was elected in April 2011 following the coup and reelected to a second term in early 2016. Niger is one of the poorest countries in the world with minimal government services and insufficient funds to develop its resource base. The largely agrarian and subsistence-based economy is frequently disrupted by extended droughts common to the Sahel region of Africa. A Tuareg rebellion emerged in 2007 and ended in 2009. Niger is facing increased security concerns on its borders from various external threats including insecurity in Libya spillover from the conflict in Mali and violent extremism in northeastern Nigeria.
overview: Niger also called the Niger officially the Republic of the Niger is a landlocked country in Western Africa named after the Niger River.

languages.name: Algerian Saharan Arabic
languages.location: Algeria, Morocco, Tunisia and Western Sahara
languages.area: Morocco border along Atlas Mountains, northeast to Medea (south of Algiers), southeast to Righ Wadi, south as far as Plateau du Tademait; some in Tamanrasset town. Also in Egypt, Niger, United States.

languages.name: North Levantine Arabic
languages.area: Also in Antigua and Barbuda, Argentina, Belize, Cyprus, Dominican Republic, Egypt, French Guiana, Israel, Jamaica, Lebanon, Mali, Puerto Rico, Suriname, Trinidad and Tobago, Turkey (Asia).

languages.name: Algerian Arabic
languages.location: Algeria, Morocco, Tunisia and Western Sahara
languages.area: Also in Belgium, Egypt, France, Germany, Saint Pierre and Miquelon.

languages.name: Libyan Arabic
languages.area: Especially north half. Also in Egypt, Niger.

languages.name: Bambara
languages.area: Also in Burkina Faso, Côte d’Ivoire, Gambia, Guinea, Mauritania, Senegal.

languages.name: Bilma Kanuri
languages.area: Northeast, Kawar region.

languages.name: Dendi (Benin)
languages.area: Atakora and Borgou provinces, along Niger River, Medru River to Nigeria border, down to Kandi. Many at Djogou and towns in the north. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Zarma
languages.area: Southwest. Also in Burkina Faso, Mali, Nigeria.

languages.name: Dazaga
languages.area: Kanem and BET regions, Borkou, Ennedi Est and Ennedi Ouest departments, north of Lake Chad and Faya-Largeau area. Also in Niger.

languages.name: French
languages.area: Also in Algeria, Andorra, Austria, Belgium, Benin, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Cameroon, Canada, Central African Republic, Chad, Comoros, Congo, Côte d’Ivoire, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Equatorial Guinea, French Guiana, French Polynesia, Gabon, Guadeloupe, Guinea, Haiti, India, Israel, Italy, Lebanon, Libya, Luxembourg, Madagascar, Mali, Martinique, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mayotte, Monaco, Morocco, Mozambique, New Caledonia, Niger, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Réunion, Rwanda, Saint Pierre and Miquelon, Saudi Arabia, Senegal, Seychelles, South Africa, Switzerland, Togo, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, U.S. Virgin Islands, Vanuatu, Wallis and Futuna.

languages.name: Western Niger Fulfulde
languages.area: West, Burkina Faso border east to Dogondoutchi area. Also in Benin, Burkina Faso.

languages.name: Central-Eastern Niger Fulfulde
languages.area: Central and east, Dogondoutchi area east to Chad border.

languages.name: Gourmanchéma
languages.area: East, Gourma, Tapoa, Gnagna, Komandjari, Yagha, and Kompienga provinces, below scrub land that blends into the Sahara. Also in Benin, Niger, Togo.

languages.name: Hausa
languages.area: Sokoto, Kaduna, Katsina, Kano, Bauchi, Jigawa, Zamfara, Kebbi, and Gombe states. Spoken as L2 in north. Also in Benin, Burkina Faso, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Chad, Congo, Eritrea, Germany, Ghana, Niger, Sudan, Togo.

languages.name: Kanembu
languages.area: Kanem, Lac regions; and Hadjer-Lamis region, Dagana Department, Massakory Subprefecture.

languages.name: Manga Kanuri
languages.area: East, along Nigeria border. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Central Kanuri
languages.area: Borno state, Kukawa, Kaga, Konduga, Maiduguri, Monguno, Ngala, Bama, Gwoza LGAs; Yobe state, Nguru, Geidam, Damaturu, Fika, Fune, and Gujba LGAs; Jigawa state, Hadejia LGA. Also in Cameroon, Chad, Eritrea, Niger, Sudan.

languages.name: Tumari Kanuri
languages.area: Tumari in N’guigmi; dialects in neighboring villages.

languages.name: Hassaniyya
languages.location: Algeria, Morocco, Tunisia and Western Sahara
languages.area: Also in Algeria, Libya, Mali, Morocco, Niger, Senegal, Western Sahara.

languages.name: Mossi
languages.area: Central Ouagadougou area; widespread. Also in Benin, Côte d’Ivoire, Ghana, Mali, Senegal, Togo.

languages.name: Koyraboro Senni Songhai
languages.area: Southeast, along Niger River from Gourma Rharous, east of Timbuktu, through Bourem, Goa, and Ansongo to Mali-Niger border. Believed to border Kaado (Zarma) [dje] in Niger.

languages.name: Chadian Arabic
languages.area: Salamat, Ouaddaï, Wadi Fira regions, Batha region center and west, much of Chari-Baguirmi; Mayo-Kebbi; north Tandjilé; Guéra. Also in Cameroon, Central African Republic, Niger, Nigeria.

languages.name: Tagdal
languages.area: Between Tahoua central, Agadez north central, and Ingall northeast.

languages.name: Tahaggart Tamahaq
languages.location: Algeria, Morocco, Tunisia and Western Sahara
languages.area: South Hoggar (Ajjer) Mountain area, Hoggar, Tamanghasset area and south to Niger border. Ghat dialect in southeast, Ganet area and west. Also in Libya, Niger.

languages.name: Tayart Tamajeq
languages.area: Central, Agadez area.

languages.name: Tawallammat Tamajaq
languages.area: Eastern dialect in central, Tahoua area from Ingal to Mali border; western in west, north and northwest of Niamey. Also in Mali, Nigeria.

languages.name: Tedaga
languages.area: Far north desert, Borkou-Ennedi-Tibesti region, Tibesti Department, Bardai area. Also in Libya, Niger, Nigeria.

languages.name: Tasawaq
languages.area: Central Niger, Ingal and Teguidda-n-Tessoumt, near Agadez.

languages.name: Yoruba
languages.area: Most of Oyo, Ogun, Ondo, Osun, Kwara, and Lagos states; Kogi state, west LGAs. Also in Benin, Sierra Leone, Togo, United Kingdom, United States.
